alert.note: Alert for Leon (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 9:12AM EDT until June 21 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Big Bend Florida, including the following counties, Gadsden and Leon. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tallahassee, Midway, Tallahassee Community College, Florida State University, Doak Campbell Stadium, Fred George Park, Messer Park, Mission San Luis, Lake Jackson, Fort Braden, Griffin Heights, Lake Talquin, Levy Park, Frenchtown, All Saints District, Leon County Civic Center, Kleman Plaza, Macon Community Park, Lake Ella and Midtown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
